bug.author: danieldn
bug.summary: "Couldn't copy application istio-ingress" error during kfctl generate on EKS
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened: Followed documentation for deploying Kubeflow on AWS <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/aws/deploy/install-kubeflow/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/aws/deploy/install-kubeflow/</denchmark-link>
Created EKS cluster using eksctl beforehand <denchmark-code>$ eksctl create cluster \ --name demo02 \ --version 1.13 \ --nodegroup-name standard-workers \ --node-type t3.medium \ --nodes 3 \ --nodes-min 1 \ --nodes-max 4 \ --node-ami auto </denchmark-code>
Completed steps 1 and 2 for fetching kfctl v0.6.2, editing kfctl_aws.yaml with IAM role name <denchmark-code>$ aws iam list-roles \ | jq -r ".Roles[] \ | select(.RoleName \ | startswith(\"eksctl-$AWS_CLUSTER_NAME\") and contains(\"NodeInstanceRole\")) \ .RoleName"
eksctl-demo02-nodegroup-standard-NodeInstanceRole-RBG4TXIX840Q </denchmark-code>
Received error on step 3 when running kfctl generate all -V <denchmark-code>Error: couldn't generate KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Generate failed for kustomize: kustomize generate failed Error: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't copy application istio-ingress </denchmark-code>
What did you expect to happen: kfctl generate all should not throw error Anything else you would like to add: First attempt running KF on AWS so appreciate any advice or guides in case missing something obvious. Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): kfctl version: (use kfctl version): v0.6.2 Kubernetes platform: (e.g. minikube) : AWS Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): 1.13 OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 1.00. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

Getting the same thing. I'm wondering if it's related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/pull/221>kubeflow/manifests#221</denchmark-link> and wondering if I can just mkdir and just copy all the base files into a folder under ${KFAPP}/kustomize/istio-ingress

I think this is an issue with a mismatch between the kubeflow/manifests master and the v0.6-branch archives. Master has recently merged istio-ingress manifests under an aws subfolder. I found I was able to generate if I modified my kfctl_aws.yaml config file to specify : <denchmark-code>repos: - name: kubeflow root: kubeflow-0.6-branch uri: https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/archive/v0.6-branch.tar.gz - name: manifests root: manifests-0.6-branch uri: https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/master.tar.gz
</denchmark-code>

I think this is an issue with a mismatch between the kubeflow/manifests master and the v0.6-branch archives. Master has recently merged istio-ingress manifests under an aws subfolder. I found I was able to generate if I modified my kfctl_aws.yaml config file to specify : repos: - name: kubeflow root: kubeflow-0.6-branch uri: https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/archive/v0.6-branch.tar.gz - name: manifests root: manifests-0.6-branch uri: https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/master.tar.gz
Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/gigi-at-zymergen>@gigi-at-zymergen</denchmark-link> for the able to get it working through this suggestion

Confirming that modifying kfctl_aws.yaml as suggested by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/gigi-at-zymergen>@gigi-at-zymergen</denchmark-link> results in generate completing with errors. Not sure if this is an expected step on behalf of user. If so, I can close and move this comment to the aws documentation

Pretty sure this is not expected and due to different release cycles and mismatch in versioning/branches for manifests repo vs. the currently released kfctl_aws.yaml file. Probably need to merge master into the v0.6-branch of the manifests repo.
